timeline.message:
Issue #832 - additional refactoring

Signed-off-by: John T.E. Timm <johntimm@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText:
should it verify that the urls match before it compares them?
two canonicals aren't comparable unless they have the same url value, right?
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: should it try to parse out the version part of the canonicals and compare those?
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: for the purpose of sorting (which is all this is used for), the value of the canonical can be compared.
replies.author: JohnTimm

timeline.bodyText: maybe add a reference to getResources(Class<T> resourceType) to make it clear how one would get all search parameters (irregardless of type)
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: worth explicitly mentioning that this can be a Resource type OR a data type (Or something else?)
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: added to the Javadoc to clarify that I am referring to constrained resource type not general type (resource, complex-type, primitive-type)
replies.author: JohnTimm

timeline.bodyText: Unrelated to this PR, but when does FHIRRegistry get initialized?  I know Mark was asking for that to happen during server start, but wasn't sure if it was addressed in this PR or not.
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: It is initialized in servlet context listener
replies.author: JohnTimm

replies.bodyText: ah, now I see it in FHIRServletContextListener.java  ...looks good
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: worth adding @throws ClassCastException to the javadoc or you think its implied?
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: worth repeating here that this is optional?
timeline.author: lmsurpre
